snippet: These missiles, never before seen in the hands of militants, would threaten military and commercial aviation and mark an escalation in illegal arms trafficking in the Arabian Peninsula.
abstract: Seizure of antiaircraft missiles in Yemen raises fears that Iran is arming rebels there.

byline.original: By C. J. CHIVERS and ROBERT F. WORTH
byline.contributor: C. J. Chivers reported from the United States and Robert F. Worth from Washington.

lead_paragraph: These missiles, never before seen in the hands of militants, would threaten military and commercial aviation and mark an escalation in illegal arms trafficking in the Arabian Peninsula.

headline.seo: Weapons Seizure in Yemen Raises Worries of Iran’s Influence
headline.main: Seizure of Antiaircraft Missiles in Yemen Raises Fears That Iran Is Arming Rebels There
headline.print_headline: Seizure of Antiaircraft Missiles in Yemen Raises Fears That Iran Is Arming Rebels There
